MessagePack types as defined in the standard, with the exception of Integer being divided into a signed Int and unsigned UInt variant in order to map directly to C++ types. <a href="#afdae9da66bac09f4b2bfc0fd9f0559e6">More...</a>

## Enumerations

### enum class  {#afdae9da66bac09f4b2bfc0fd9f0559e6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>enum class llvm::msgpack::Type : uint8&#95;t</>}
 labels = {["strong"]}>
MessagePack types as defined in the standard, with the exception of Integer being divided into a signed Int and unsigned UInt variant in order to map directly to C++ types.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

The types map onto corresponding union members of the <code><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/msgpack/object">Object</a></code> struct.
